intro: Allenanthus erythrocarpus, commonly known as the red-fruited sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, pale green to reddish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its fruits are small, dry, and red, giving it its common name. Allenanthus erythrocarpus thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. It is often found in coastal and inland dune environments, contributing to soil stabilization in these harsh habitats.
